attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM66ZmCsKZ63rN02AVp_description
attribs.current: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and can live to be 750 years old.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM66ZmINqiVv5qREVlp_description
attribs.current: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM66ZmNnVUlgHMM6LVh_description
attribs.current: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM66ZmSm-ZHooVs7a7R_description
attribs.current: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM66ZmWoqUVBLQaG8wh_description
attribs.current: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM66ZmZHyOmLqezqHqz_description
attribs.current:
Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

If you meditate during a long rest, you finish the rest after only 4 hours. You otherwise obey all the rules for a long rest; only the duration is changed.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM66ZmdcxflgASgVXVD_description
attribs.current: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM66ZmgmuYXg-qmxI0N_description
attribs.current: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM66ZmkOaXzJ5RmXQW0_description
attribs.current: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM66Zmnr9kWtzrAhnDV_description
attribs.current: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM69KWoAKtCUISZ49iL_description
attribs.current:
At 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiencies, or one of your skill proficiencies and your proficiency with thieves' tools. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies (in skills or with thieves' tools) to gain this benefit.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM69KWwKSmxxS6DUI1T_description
attribs.current:
Beginning at 1st level, you know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.

You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM69KX0t54RRj3F-586_description
attribs.current:
During your rogue training you learned thieves' cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation. Only another creature that knows thieves' cant understands such messages. It takes four times longer to convey such a message than it does to speak the same idea plainly.

In addition, you understand a set of secret signs and symbols used to convey short, simple messages, such as whether an area is dangerous or the territory of a thieves' guild, whether loot is nearby, or whether the people in an area are easy marks or will provide a safe house for thieves on the run.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM69KX75yG-ibiBgXWV_description
attribs.current: Starting at 2nd level, your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM69KXBs89qRorxpAVr_description
attribs.current:
2nd-level rogue feature (enhances Cunning Action)

You gain an additional way to use your Cunning Action: carefully aiming your next attack. As a bonus action, you give yourself advantage on your next attack roll on the current turn. You can use this bonus action only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use the bonus action, your speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM69KXG3wvfhQTNQ4iE_description
attribs.current:
3rd-level rogue optional feature

As a bonus action, you give yourself advantage on your next attack roll on the current turn. You can use this bonus action only if you haven't moved during this turn, and after you use the bonus action, your speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM69KXKZW67AZbhjalO_description
attribs.current:
4th-level feature (enhances Ability Score Improvement)

When you gain the Ability Score Improvement feature from your class, you can also replace one of your skill proficiencies with a skill proficiency offered by your class at 1st level (the proficiency you replace needn't be from the class).

This change represents one of your skills atrophying as you focus on a different skill.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM69KXOY32ZeMWyirRD_description
attribs.current: Starting at 5th level, when an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM6EiZIxJs0zPrW24-S_description
attribs.current:
You have mastered ranged weapons and can make shots that others find impossible. You gain the following benefits:

    Attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.

    Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover.

    Before you make an attack with a ranged weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If that attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damag

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-NM6HEv2qgs-XqYMRi2S_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Ranged Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 150/600,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-NM6Ij85ZVsV0KQrx72G_itemcontent
attribs.current: This set of tools includes a small file, a set of lock picks, a small mirror mounted on a metal handle, a set of narrow-bladed scissors, and a pair of pliers. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to disarm traps or open locks.

attribs.name: repeating_proficiencies_-NM6J1mNT0lCSWNrYYme_name
attribs.current: Simple Weapons, Longsword, Hand Crossbows, Rapier, Shortsword

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-NM6JZyR2gUpiBz1T3EM_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d8, Damage Type: Piercing

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-NM6Jl48QyjA7UtRCb-f_itemcontent
attribs.current: Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-NM6K3PQilqiIMI4Tf0x_itemcontent
attribs.current:
Includes:

• a backpack

• a bag of 1,000 ball bearings

• 10 feet of string

• a bell

• 5 candles

• a crowbar

• a hammer

• 10 pitons

• a hooded lantern

• 2 flasks of oil

• 5 days rations

• a tinderbox

• a waterskin

• 50 feet of hempen rope

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-NM6K8Cxeo0YijuUNy5S_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Melee Weapon, Damage: 1d4, Damage Type: Piercing, Range: 20/60,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20,Critical Range: 20

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-NM6L7cbZGD74--fR-Hy_itemcontent
attribs.current: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-NM6L7ciR6omCZxRJUY1_itemcontent
attribs.current: Category: Items, Item Type: adventuring gear, Weight: 3, Requires Attunement: No

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-NM6L7coIH0EJJorF3TK_itemcontent
attribs.current: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch. A pouch can hold up to ⅕ cubic foot or 6 pounds of gear.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NM6LKMgdQZqL8qbIeir_description
attribs.current: You have a reliable and trustworthy contact who acts as your liaison to a network of other criminals. You know how to get messages to and from your contact, even over great distances; specifically, you know the local messengers, corrupt caravan masters, and seedy sailors who can deliver messages for you.

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
I always have a plan for when things go wrong.
The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Charity. I steal from the wealthy so that I can help people in need. (Good)

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I'm guilty of a terrible crime. I hope I can redeem myself for it.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: When faced with a choice between money and my friends, I usually choose the money.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-NMBBJOHzGrcdmq3528J_itemcontent
attribs.current: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NMBHmcCnup8tLbpYhVB_description
attribs.current:
As a bonus action, you give yourself advantage on
your next attack roll on the current turn. You can
use this bonus action only if you haven't moved
during this turn, and after you use the bonus action,
your speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-NMBLW5mFT9XsjJWsajR_description
attribs.current:
A partir do 3° nível, você fica mais mortal quando pega seus oponentes desprevenidos. Você tem vantagem nas jogadas de
ataque contra qualquer criatura que ainda não tenha chegado ao turno dela no combate.
Além disso, quando você aplicar seu ataque furtivo, você pode fazer com que o ataque se torne um crítico. Após fazer isso 2
vezes, você deve realizar um descanso curto ou longo para recuperar os usos dessa característica.
